body.p: Pleas before James Stewart, Judge of the McLean Circuit Court, at the Court House in Calhoun March 17, 1864

Comth of Kentucky
vs } Indictment
John Eirwin & Isaac Vertrees

The Grand Jury of McLean County, in the name & by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse John Eirwin & Issac Vertrees not being physicians of the Offence of giving, loaning & Selling Spiritious, Malt & Vinious liquors to the Slave of Another, not having at the time said Slave under their Control, & Without the written Order of the Owner of Sd Slave or of the person having the legal Control of the Service, for the time being of Said Slave Committed as follows viz-

The Said John Eirwin & Isaac Vertrees, not being Physicians on the day of October 1861 Son divers days since, in the County afsd did give, loan & Sell Spiritous, Malt & Vinious Liquors to Henry a Slave, & the property Philip Hicks, and they Sd Eirwin & Vertrees, not having then & there Said Slave under their Controll

and not having then and there the Written Order of the Said Philip Hicks or of the person Who then & there, had the equal control of the Service of Said Slave, against the Peace & dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

p.note:
Endorsed a true bill
J M Hancock
forem of Grand Jury

Bench Warrant Executed against Isaac Vertrees, and Bail Given, for $10000 12th Sept 1863.
Bench Warrant against John Eirwin Executed & Bail Given 12th Sept 1863

Comth of Ky Plff
Against } Indict.
Isaac Vertrees Deft

This day Came as well the Atty for the Comth & defts in proper person and the law and facts of the prosecution were Submitted to the Court who after hearing the evidences and arguments of Counsel thereon, rendered a Joint Judgment

against the defendants of $5000 and costs herein expended to which plff excepts It is therefore adjudged by the Court, that the defendts make their fine to the Comth by the payment of $5000 and the Costs herein expended and a Capias profine may issue & the defts may be taken & Co. And defendants moved the Court for a new trial which motion was Overruled by the Court, to which the defendant excepts.

I Louis L Moore clerk of the McLean Circuit Court do certify that the foregoing pages contain a full transcript of the writ of the Comth & Eirwin & Vertrees as of record in my office this 12th day of April 1864
Louis L Moore C. M. C. C

McLean Cir Ct
